result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Laural Erickson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:14 AM Defendant Tommy Laural Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Tommy Laural Erickson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice. 
Court notes bond motion filed by Defendant. Attorney Reid indicates has come up with $2000 with his family to cover both files. 
State is opposed to any modification. Believes bail set currently is appropriate. Cites prior matters and prior FTA's. Was on a deferred agreement in the past which was terminated. Probation revoked in other matters. Has FTA's in virtually every case he has ever had. 
Attorney Reid makes rebuttal arguments. Reiterates that family has helped him come up with this amount. 
Court makes statements. Has not been in custody very long. Serious charges in 22CF380. Bad history of appearing. Court notes amount can post is significant. 
Court orders in 22CF379 $1000 cash, conditions to continue
Court orders in 22CF380 $1500 cash, conditions to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Tommy Laural Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Tommy Laural Erickson. Court calls cases 22CF379 and 22CF380. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint of both files, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor counts, and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $2500 cash in 22CF380, No special conditions. 22CF379, $500 cash. No contact with B.P. State notes resisting officers and attempt to escape custody. 7 FTAs in prior cases and has been revoked from probation. Attorney Reid notes that defendant has lived in the county his whole life and has family in the county. Notes prior convictions and FTAs, asks for $500 across both files. 
Court notes concerns over charges alleged.
Court orders $2500 in 22CF380. Comply with all laws. $1000 in 22CF379. No contact with B.P.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
